STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 21, 2023
Tishara Price
Macomb County DHHS
44777 N. Gratiot Rd.
Clinton Township, MI. 48038-4451
Re: License #: CP500201269
Dear Ms. Price:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
November 14, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, area manager at 616- 204 -6992.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 (2)(b) Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child and
parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at least once
every 90 calendar days thereafter.
1 of 8 foster care cases reviewed and one of 29 updated service plans were
late.
FOM POLICY 722 – 06B F amily Team Meeting: Types and Timeframes
FTM’s must occur within the required time frames as outlined…Updated Case Plan
(USP) – within 30 days prior to the service plan due date.
2 of 8 foster care files did not meet FTM requirements.
2

FOM POLICY 722. 08D TREATMENT PLANS - AGREEMENT AND
S IGNATURES
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must obtain signatures from the
following individuals, as applicable:
Caseworker, Supervisor, second line supervisor, when siblings in care are
place apart, Parents who are a member of a participating household. Youth ages
14 and older. Foster parents, relative caregivers, and unrelated court-ordered
caregivers. Parents/legal guardians, youth, and caregivers must check yes or no
for the following when signing the treatment plan: I have participated in the
Development of the Case Service Plan and the Parent Agency Treatment Plan.
7 of 8 open foster care case files reviewed (15 of 29 PATPS) contained PATP signatures
that were not obtained timely and/or the boxes were not checked indicating participation
of the service plans.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency was provided TA on R400.12306 (3) Application request.
There was an error in CWLM that had a date for the renewal application not
documented per the 60 calendar days required. The agency was advised to
correct this issue with the CWLM helpdesk.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No Consultation was provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The current Director reported Macomb continues to struggle with staff turnover
however recently the FC training unit was created to further support new hires and
other staff with the foundation of child welfare and needed support. Macomb
currently has seven FC vacancies.
The Director reported there is a designated day each month that staff and
supervisors are reviewing all direct service cases focusing on different areas of the
3

case. Macomb conducts weekly KPI meetings with first- and second-line
management to address and troubleshoot areas of improvement and share
process to support service specialists.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Staff interviewed reported their supervisors and coworkers were their biggest
support system they rely on the most. They enjoy the flexibility provided to them
to work their cases. Staff reported they would change the CWLM system if they
could as well as adjust the foster care payment system for families to assist the
payments to go smoothly and timely. There was also some discussion around the
amount of work/task that the staff is assigned making it hard to keep up at times.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has sufficient office space and equipment to perform the job functions.
The case files & CHRI records are stored in locked cabinets to prevent
unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that Macomb County DHHS agency continue on their regular
license.
11/17/2023
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 21, 2023
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
4
